title: Strines Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Stephen Craven / Top end of Strines reservoir
images.caption: Top end of Strines reservoir. The end of the reservoir from the west, with Sigworth Hall and tower on the far side.

images.title: Stephen Charles / Bents House, south of Strines Reservoir
images.caption: Bents House, south of Strines Reservoir.

images.title: Stephen Charles / View of Strines Reservoir
images.caption: View of Strines Reservoir. Taken from window of Strines Inn. Highly recommended place to stay.

images.title: Michael Knapton / Boot's Folly at Strines Reservoir
images.caption: Boot's Folly at Strines Reservoir. Boot's Folly was built by a local man Charles Boot in 1927 to provide work during the depression. It is a conspicuous landmark in the countryside to the west of Sheffield.

images.title: Neil Theasby / Strines Reservoir on a frosty day in March
images.caption: Reservoir on a frosty day in March

images.title: Stephen Charles / This house is called Brogging
images.caption: The Ancient Brogging House,  the former reservoir-keeper's house

description: This walk visit Strines Reservoir in Bradfield Dale near the city of Sheffield. There's some roadside parking just to the west of the reservoir. You can pick up footpaths heading between Strines and the adjacent Dale Dike Reservoir before climbing towards Sugworth Hall. On the walk look out for the historic Brogging House, a dwelling which pre-dates the reservoir by some time, being recorded as being leased by George Woodhead in 1715. The house stands at the north end of the dam wall and at one time served as the reservoir-keeper's house when one was required.
